intro: Randia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and opposite, narrow leaves. It typically grows as an herbaceous shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Randia stenophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
